channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 他们住在谷仓里，奶牛不断踩到地雷，90% 的邻居都不在了。但这些乌克兰村民发誓要在俄罗斯占领的恐怖之后重建家园。
item.description:
They live in barns, their cows keep stepping on land mines and 90% of their neighbors are gone. But these Ukrainian villagers vow to rebuild after the horrors of Russian occupation. https://t.co/S7rDZ3kuIv https://t.co/S7rDZ3kuIv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: Covid 改变了很多东西。其中包括：我们对工作的投入。我们不再像以前那样关心工作。
item.description:
Covid changed a lot of things. Among them: our devotion to our jobs. We don’t care nearly as much about work as we used to. https://t.co/c6eVtAVZt9 https://t.co/c6eVtAVZt9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 许多年轻人希望远程工作。但这可能意味着他们在工作中交到的朋友更少。
item.description:
Many younger people want to work remotely. But that could mean they make fewer friends at work. https://t.co/NmfsGUahT7 https://t.co/NmfsGUahT7

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: @timkhiggins 写道：埃隆-马斯克对拜登总统的看法很明确，但对唐纳德-特朗普的看法却比较保守
item.description:
Elon Musk is clear about his thoughts on President Biden but is holding his cards closer on Donald Trump, @timkhiggins writes https://t.co/VdxJD0hdcS https://t.co/VdxJD0hdcS

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 里奇-科恩不在乎影评人怎么说：在黯淡的 20 世纪 70 年代的美国，《洛奇》理应击败《出租车司机》，获得奥斯卡最佳影片奖
item.description:
Rich Cohen doesn't care what the film critics say: In a bleak 1970s America, "Rocky" deserved to beat "Taxi Driver" for the Best Picture Oscar https://t.co/Fnsq4dsi1t https://t.co/Fnsq4dsi1t

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 街谈巷议：@telisdemos 写道：硅谷银行倒闭一年后，新提议的法规无法解决地区银行业萎靡不振的一些根本原因
item.description:
Heard on the Street: A year after Silicon Valley Bank’s collapse, new proposed regulations won’t address some root causes of regional banking malaise, @telisdemos writes https://t.co/VD3ggZ3mFN https://t.co/VD3ggZ3mFN

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 我们的手机、电脑和汽车几乎了解我们的一切。拜伦-陶（Byron Tau）写道，现在，数据经纪人正在向美国执法部门和间谍机构出售这些个人信息。
item.description:
Our phones, computers and cars know almost everything about us. Now data brokers are selling that personal information to U.S. law enforcement and spy agencies, writes Byron Tau. https://t.co/4ro6aiJxY7 https://t.co/4ro6aiJxY7

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 杰米-戴蒙说，一场 "飓风 "将袭击经济。雷-达里奥预见到了 "债务危机"。但灾难并未降临。"我当时看跌，"达里奥说。"我错了。"
item.description:
Jamie Dimon said a “hurricane” would hit the economy. Ray Dalio foresaw a “debt crisis.” The disaster never came. “I was bearish,” Dalio says. “I got it wrong.” https://t.co/d1vR70lqKC https://t.co/d1vR70lqKC

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：@ConnorPfeiffer 写道：随着符合 USMCA 标准的中国电动汽车可能涌入市场，美国、墨西哥和加拿大都会有所损失，因此应该积极制定联合应对措施。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: With the possibility of USMCA-compliant Chinese EVs flooding the market, the U.S., Mexico and Canada all have something to lose and should be proactive in developing a joint response, writes @ConnorPfeiffer https://t.co/38N9zTUfqx

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：拜登四年前获胜是因为选民想要没有特朗普的特朗普经济。@jasonrileywsj 写道：拜登并没有做到这一点，如果他想获胜，他必须做的不仅仅是称对手是对民主的威胁。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Biden won four years ago because voters wanted the Trump economy without Trump. That’s not what Biden delivered, and he’ll have to do more than call his opponent a threat to democracy if he’s going to win, writes @jasonrileywsj. https://t.co/fUMtPkMOxJ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 在当今的 "勾搭 "文化中，性的竞争环境并不公平，但假装公平却符合男性的利益。路易丝-佩里写道，女性有权愤怒。
item.description:
In today’s hookup culture the sexual playing field is not even, but it suits men’s interests to pretend that it is. Women are entitled to be angry, writes Louise Perry. https://t.co/9tFZljkg1N https://t.co/9tFZljkg1N

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 一家位于得克萨斯州的公司可以将您亲人的火化遗体送入轨道、深空或月球。但是，将月球视为神圣之地的纳瓦霍部落正在进行反击。
item.description:
A Texas-based company can send your loved ones’ cremated remains into orbit, deep space or to the moon. But the Navajo Nation, who considers the moon sacred, is pushing back. https://t.co/6LbPCrTK3O https://t.co/6LbPCrTK3O

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 一个恶性循环阻碍了几乎所有基本援助物资到达加沙被摧毁的北部地区。援助人员说，只有大规模、持续地增援才能避免迫在眉睫的饥荒。
item.description:
A vicious cycle is preventing almost any basic aid from reaching Gaza’s devastated north. Only a massive and sustained surge of it can avert a looming famine, aid workers say. https://t.co/wsiLmKdrKz https://t.co/wsiLmKdrKz

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 与特朗普和共和党相比，拜登和民主党拥有巨大的现金优势，并向各州党派提供了更多资金来建设竞选基础设施
item.description:
Biden and Democrats have a big cash advantage over Trump and Republicans and have funneled far more to state parties to build campaign infrastructure https://t.co/QnsLUbYTRc https://t.co/QnsLUbYTRc

item.title: 看：在 Nvidia 的总部，使其成为美国最有价值公司之一的芯片也被用于定制软件，这些软件帮助设计了其办公室--现在是科技行业最受欢迎的工作场所之一。华尔街日报》带您参观。
item.description:
Watch: At Nvidia’s headquarters, the chips that made it one of the U.S.’s most valuable companies were also used in custom software that helped design its office—now one of the tech industry's most sought-after places to work. WSJ takes a tour. https://t.co/NOV0wxs7z2

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024

item.title: 把奖杯戴在手腕上会让你立刻被认为自命不凡。为什么您的下一款强力腕表应该是一款谦逊的炫耀之作？
item.description:

item.title: 前政变领导人居伊-菲利普（Guy Philippe）曾因洗钱罪在美国监狱服刑六年。现在，他说他想成为海地总统。

item.title: Kaia Gerber 深知作为 nepo 宝宝的好处。"她说："我个人非常清楚这对我的好处，我绝不会说任何负面的话。
item.description:

item.title: ☕ 最好的一天始于一杯好咖啡；这一点毋庸置疑。但是，最好的咖啡是如何制作出来的？以下是关于晨间冲泡咖啡的五个神话，以及为什么它们都是胡说八道。
item.description:

item.title: 为了了解 500 万美元在退休生活中能买到什么，我们采访了全国各地拥有这个数字储蓄的退休人员。在这里，他们畅谈了自己的财务生活以及如何花费时间和金钱。
item.description:
To find out what $5 million buys in retirement, we spoke to retirees around the country with savings in that ballpark. Here, they open up about their financial lives and how they spend their time and money. https://t.co/WV4dgblPma https://t.co/WV4dgblPma

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 9, 2024
